page.title: 19FARMING SAMPLE STUDIES
page.content: Cont. from page 18 permanent grass.Sixty_three acres of the grass are cut for silage and hay and the rest is grazed by cattle.The farmer's fields are bordered by hedges and fences.The soil varies from heavy to light but it does not need any special treatment apart from drainage pipes.The barley and kale are used on the farm for animal feed and the oil seed rape is sold to a merchant.Only a small percentage of the farmers income comes from crops. The farmer has a dairy herd which consists of 90 cows and heifers in milk,1 bull and 44 young cattle.The cattle are all Friesians.They are kept outside for most of the year and fed on grass.In the winter they are fed on concentrates,hay,straw,kale and silage.All the cattle are born on the farm and each year between 6 and 12
